data.title: Resizing project explorer after clicking menu key while hovering context menu

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Pressing the menu key ("RMB" on keyboard) while the mouse is hovering over a context menu opened by right-clicking (or using the menu key) in the document will start resizing the project explorer.

Steps:
1.  Open a document (empty or not, does not matter)
2.  Right-click in the document to bring up the context menu
3.  Hover over one of the entries in the context menu with the mouse
4.  Press the menu key ([Wikipedia picture](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Kontextmen%C3%BC.jpg/220px-Kontextmen%C3%BC.jpg))

I'm not sure what I expect to happen, but it's not this.

And webm: http://morten242.com/sharex/2016/02/2016-02-16_08-59-52.webm

Version 10.8
Reproducible even with --disable-extensions
No errors created in console
Running Windows 10

data.title: gulpfile.babel.js support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
gulp configuration file can also be named `gulpfile.babel.js` then gulp will automatically require babel registry before running gulp tasks.
But it seems VSCode cannot recognize `gulpfile.babel.js`.

data.title: Rules settings for the format code command
data.body:
It would be great to be able to define rules for the **format code** command. 
Personnally, I would need to change the default indentation level for specific code lines (wrapped lines) and to disable the command for the comments. (They are indented when I wouldn't like to)

Also, this improvement can be used in different languages not in the same way, I recognize it could take time to make it available.

data.title: Typescript highlighting after "extends" keyword
data.body:
It seems everything after "extends" turns into an identifier, when it should just be the very next word since there's only single inheritance. This is a problem if you implement an interface...

data.title: Fixed small bug related to issue #2662.
data.body: We were showing "1 characters". This fix will remove the "s" when count is singluar.

data.title: Adding optout option for telemetry
data.body:
This change will add a user setting that will allow to optout of reporting telemetry. The product will allow a set of predefined events to pass the user optin settings. This way we can calculate the optin rates. 

The change include: 
- Refactor `ITelemetryConfiguration` from `mainTelemetryService` to `telemetry.ts`
- Add a configuration option from the `ElectronTelemetryService`. This service will be responsible for caching the events that are reported until the user optin settings are loaded. After that, the service will flush the events. This is to prevent race conditions as some events are reported on load (auto save, workspace stats, workspace load). 
- Add a mechanism to allow for a predefined events to pass user optout settings in `mainTelemetryService`. 
- Tests

data.title: vscode javascript intellisense namespaces
gulp default task (compile-all) doesn't exist
data.body:
The 'default' task is mapped to 'compile-all', but that task isn't defined.
### STR
1. Clone repo
2. Run `./scripts/npm.sh install --arch=x64`
3. Run `gulp`
### Expected results

It builds
### Actual results

```
colby@ruta-corsica:/tmp/other$ gulp
[12:17:18] Using gulpfile /tmp/other/gulpfile.js
[12:17:18] Task 'compile-all' is not in your gulpfile
[12:17:18] Please check the documentation for proper gulpfile formatting
```
### Temporary workaround

Run `gulp compile` instead

data.title: Document how to use OSS build as a daily driver

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Need to document how to get an OSS build into working condition as a daily driver.

Having this process documented in a central location would also be useful for package maintainers.  (For example, if Ubuntu were to decide to start shipping vscode.)

Compared to the 0.10.8 (January) release of vscode, the oss build also includes vscode-api-tests, but it's removed in the release version, which makes sense.

The release version also includes jrieken.vscode-omnisharp, but the oss build doesn't.  (Not really sure why.  Probably an oversight?).

Aside from that, the only other difference I can find with the extensions is that the node-debug and mono-debug "extensions" in the oss build are just stub packages (node-debug-placeholder and mono-debug-placeholder).

As noted in [issue #60, comment 6](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/60#issuecomment-161792005), the release ships with a different product.json.  Some of the differences are cosmetic, others fill in service endpoints.  Here are the most notable differences:
- The extensionsGallery property is set in the release build.  Notable because it controls whether the "Install Extensions" item shows up in the command palette, and downstream packagers should set this to something appropriate if they want to enable extension downloads from within the product.
- The dataFolderName is changed.  Notable because it controls where (some of) the user configuration and extensions are stored.  If the VSCODE_DEV environment variable is set, it will use the directory name obtained by appending "-dev" to the dataFolderName value.  (The vscode launch scripts for the oss build set VSCODE_DEV by default.)
- crash reporting and telemetry are enabled in the release build.

This isn't an exhaustive listing, but it's not meant to be.  However, some document that includes this information needs to exist, and going ahead and mentioning it in this comment is a starting point.

data.title: Path doesn't work in OS X cannot find Gulp
data.body:
I have gulp installed in /usr/local/bin/gulp, Visual Studio Code isn't able to find it when I use just the file name in a task.

Failed to launch external program gulp .

If I set the path to the full path to gulp I instead get this message.

env: node: No such file or directory

data.title: Start button gets hidden in debug pane
data.body: When making the debug pane' size smaller Start button gets hidden.

data.title: Pressing tab with a selection in JavaScript code window deletes selection
data.body:
VSCode 10.8, OSX El Capitan, MBP
Given the following scenario:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1798835/13054608/a61b950e-d402-11e5-9ffc-c717ec5b2fff.png)

Pressing tab now produces this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1798835/13054623/b335ee60-d402-11e5-95ac-d07f74be53cf.png)

The undo buffer is empty. 

Potential regression in 0.10.8, this feature worked fine in 0.10.7

UPDATE: this behavior is not predictable. If there are tab characters in the selection, or tab has been used already in the page other places, then it looks like working, but then again, not always.

Please consider this rather serious, as it can actually cause loss of code - if you have unsaved changes, since you cant undo.

data.title: C# constructors - argument hints not displaying
data.body:
Hi there,

I have noticed that code hints for C# class constructors are not displaying correctly. The issue seems specific to constructors only.

![hint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3048342/13049047/fcfc76d0-d44e-11e5-9954-466961e8aa2e.PNG)

It seems that vscode is pulling from generated XML metadata for the class if its available. In all other cases, it displays no argument information at all.

![hint2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3048342/13048853/a997928c-d44d-11e5-93d3-b2432d9ec81b.png)

Many Thanks

data.title: Switching windows should not close the commands list

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: On Windows, when VSCode loses the focus, (by switching windows for example), the commands list is closed once I switch back. I think it should stay on the same state.

data.title: Intellisense render cheese
data.body: ![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13044935/03faf714-d3d1-11e5-9921-1d438b342cee.gif)

data.title: ext install <ID>
data.body:
We need a way to install extensions by specifying its ID. This would ensure end-users install the correct extension when asked for.

Example, I want a colleague to install the [`webfreak.debug`](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=webfreak.debug) extension which has the misleading `Debug` name. As of now, I cannot just tell him to `Ctrl+P` and `ext install webfreak.debug`. I have to give some search keywords and warn about the fact that the correct extension is the one which comes from `webfreak`.

data.title: Permanantly disappearing code upon undo after trying to indent highlighted code with tab
data.body:
In most editors that I have used, if I want to indent a highlighted block of code, I just do so by highlighting it as below, and hitting the tab key.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10870777/13041043/80341590-d381-11e5-8b40-cd61a8717447.png)

However, as shown in the below screenshot, the code disappears.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10870777/13041057/c1ab96f6-d381-11e5-9ea0-d474ef8c9815.png)

The worst part is that when I undo this, rather than going to the state before hitting tab, the text does not fully restore, and this undo action even distorts code below the selection area, as shown in the following screenshot.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10870777/13041079/fa7b1128-d381-11e5-81f4-d253755cc399.png)
